21: FTP is insecure and transmits data in plain text.
23: Telnet is unencrypted and insecure. Consider using SSH.
80: HTTP lacks encryption. Use HTTPS instead.
139: NetBIOS over TCP/IP can expose file shares.
445: SMB can be abused for lateral movement or ransomware.
3306: MySQL exposed over the network may be vulnerable to brute-force or misconfiguration.
3389: RDP is a common target for brute-force and remote exploits.
http: HTTP is unencrypted and vulnerable to MITM attacks.
mysql: MySQL is often misconfigured and may leak data.
